question: Which country is currently re-designated as the part of “Particular concern” under the US’ International Religious Freedom Act of 1998?
explanation: On December 2019, the US’ Department of State has re-designated Iran, Myanmar, Pakistan, North Korea, China, Eritrea, Saudi Arabia, Tajikistan and Turkmenistan as countries of Particular Concern under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. These countries were engaged in or tolerated “systematic, ongoing and egregious violations of religious freedom\".
